metadata.name: Gate Of Stars
metadata.description:
Caravanserai
More than two thousand years ago, throughout the East, along the route of commercial caravans, buildings were erected for inns or even, when necessary, a stronghold against enemy attacks. This building was called an inn. Most caravans and travelers stopped at caravanserais for the night.

The caravanserais along the long Silk Road, like a beacon in the heart of the deserts, have guided trade caravans from ancient times to early modern times.
